description: From Ottoman Turkish بلغور‎ (bulğur) (modern Turkish bulgur), by metathesis from older بورغول‎ (burğul), from Arabic بُرْغُل‎ (burḡul), from Persian برغول‎ (barğul), پرغول‎ (parğul).

entries.meaning: Wheat grains that have been steamed, dried, and crushed; a staple of Middle Eastern cooking.
